title: Image of Kanhaiya Kumar seen standing before a map with few Indian states shown as a part of Pakistan is photoshopped
subtitle: Image showing Kanhaiya Kumar giving a speech before a map with few states of India shown as a part of Pakistan is photoshopped. In the original image, there is no map behind Kanhaiya Kumar
author: factly.in
vclaim:
An image of Kanhaiya Kumar giving a speech before a map with Kashmir and Gujarat shown as a part of Pakistan is being shared widely on social media. Let’s try to check the claim made in the post.



Claim: Image shows Kanhaiya Kumar giving a speech before a map with few states of India shown as a part of Pakistan’. Fact: The image in the post is a photoshopped one. In the original image, there is no map behind Kanhaiya Kumar. So, the claim is FALSE.

When the image in the post is subjected to Google reverse image search technique, a link of ‘The Hindu’ article was obtained in the search results. The article had a similar image, but there was no map behind Kanaiah Kumar.

In the search results, a video was also obtained and in the video, Kanhaiya Kumar can be seen giving a speech with the same shirt on and also, holding a pen in his right hand as seen in the image posted. But in that video, no map can be seen in the background during his entire speech. So, the image in the post is a photoshopped one.

To conclude, this image of Kanhaiya Kumar standing before a map with few Indian states shown as a part of Pakistan is photoshopped.
